head.title: L293D DC Motor Circuit and Driver
head.subtitle: Controlling a DC motors speed and direction in Rust on the Raspberry Pi.
head.description: Controlling a DC motor is easy enough. However, the L293D chip allows us to control the direction and speed programmatically. And, we can do it in Rust!

contents.contents: Sometimes when your designing a circuit, all you want is something to spin, twirl, move, or blink. It's boring sometimes! And our dumb lizard brains want to see something happen. Well, the L293D chip makes controlling dc motors a breeze.
Unfortunately, I didn't have a stepper motor on hand. However, you can also control a single stepper motor with this chip without much struggle.
You can check out the datasheets and full source code in the links below.
L293D Motor Driver Github Source Code
More unfortunately, I don't have a digital potentiometer on hand either! I need to get some supplies... So for now, I am just going to use a regular potentimeter to control the speed.
